normalised: Rental Agreements: Don't Get Stuck Paying Extra Tea!

unnormalised: Mumbai: Renting in the city of dreams, eh? Listen up, folks, before you sign that rental agreement! Landlords are getting sneaky, adding clauses you wouldn't believe!
normalised: Mumbai: Renting in the city of dreams, eh? Listen up, folks, before you sign that rental agreement! Landlords are getting sneaky, adding clauses you wouldn't believe!

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, a consumer rights advocate in Bandra, warns tenants to scrutinize EVERYTHING. "Read beyond the basic Rs. 20,000 rent! Check for hidden charges - maintenance, parking (especially in areas like Navi Mumbai!), and even ridiculous clauses like extra charges for guests staying over!"
normalised: Doctor Sharma, a consumer rights advocate in Bandra, warns tenants to scrutinize everything. "Read beyond the basic rupee twenty thousand rent! Check for hidden charges - maintenance, parking (especially in areas like Navi Mumbai!), and even ridiculous clauses like extra charges for guests staying over!"

unnormalised: Reports indicate some landlords are adding clauses that hold tenants responsible for wear and tear beyond normal usage. Think chipped paint after 5 years? You could be paying!
normalised: Reports indicate some landlords are adding clauses that hold tenants responsible for wear and tear beyond normal usage. Think chipped paint after five years? You could be paying!

unnormalised: Make sure the agreement clearly states the deposit amount and the conditions for its return. Also, document the property's condition (take photos!) BEFORE you move in to avoid disputes later.
normalised: Make sure the agreement clearly states the deposit amount and the conditions for its return. Also, document the property's condition (take photos!) before you move in to avoid disputes later.

unnormalised: And for goodness sake, register your agreement! It's not just about legal formality; it's protection. An unregistered agreement is practically useless in court.
normalised: And for goodness sake, register your agreement! It's not just about legal formality; it's protection. An unregistered agreement is practically useless in court.

unnormalised: Negotiate everything! That "non-negotiable" clause about no modifications (even hanging a picture!)? Push back!
normalised: Negotiate everything! That "non-negotiable" clause about no modifications (even hanging a picture!)? Push back!

unnormalised: Remember, a well-drafted rental agreement can save you a lot of headache (and Rs.) down the line. Get it checked by a lawyer, even if it costs a few extra chai-paani. This could save you from losing your deposit on your 600 sq ft apartment!
normalised: Remember, a well-drafted rental agreement can save you a lot of headache (and rupees) down the line. Get it checked by a lawyer, even if it costs a few extra tea-water. This could save you from losing your deposit on your six hundred square feet apartment!
